name: Chicken Pad Thai
author: Karen Barris Calabro
summary: A classic authentic chicken pad Thai made simpler than most other recipes. Additional vegetables such as eggplant, squash, peppers, green beans, broccoli, snow peas, and mushrooms can be tossed in as well.
ingredients: 1 (16 ounce) package dried flat rice noodles (such as ban pho)
¼ medium head cabbage, thinly sliced
1 dash sriracha sauce, or to taste  (Optional)
directions: Bring water to a boil in a large pot, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat and toss in rice noodles; wait 5 minutes
Drain and rinse in a colander
Combine fish sauce, agave syrup, lime juice, and garlic in a bowl and set aside
Heat 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a small omelet pan over low heat
Add egg and cook through without flipping, about 5 minutes
Set aside on a cutting board until cooled, about 15 minutes
Roll into a log and cut into thin strips
Heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil in a skillet over high heat
Add chicken, onion, and shallot and saute until fairly browned, 5 to 10 minutes
Add cabbage, carrots, and drained noodles; saute until well combined, about 5 minutes more
Add fish sauce mixture, egg slices, basil, and sriracha sauce to the saute pan with the noodle mixture
Toss well, cover with a lid, and cook for 2 minutes
Remove lid from saute pan and toss in peanuts
Serve in the pan or transfer to a large platter
